answers.answer: I had it done. I was already having contractions though. but it was the day after my baby was due, so they swept me, and then just started to induce me. when your body is ready, it's ready. after going through what I went through with the delivery of my daughter, and 3 miscarriages (one being 17wks and birthing him with no drugs just in September), I'd totally have wished I did things differently.I know it's hard to relax cause you want to meet your baby. but it's well worth it.
oh, also - it didn't "hurt" - felt more uncomfortable. my Dr. had HUGE hands though. lol. so it was twice as bad. kind of feels like he's reaching in your vag and moving his hand around a lot.

Sounds unpleasant, I'm sorry for your loss! I would definitely wait if they'd let me, they're inducing me fully on Monday if nothings happened before then due to preeclampsia. So hoping that a more natural form of induction will work!
I'd like to stay drug free and not have an iv if possible.
I had mine tuesday and it kinda hurt very uncomfortable to me
Did it do anything for you?
Ftm but what's a stretch and sweep?

thanks. it's been tough but if I have my way next time, i'll opt for a drug free and natural birth if I can. and yeah, I guess there's a reason for it with that complication. still ****** to try to force your body into labor though :(

question: What to expect? Does it hurt? Does it work? Im 39+6 and getting one done in two hours!
title: stretch and sweep.
